009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
012import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
013import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
014import java.lang.annotation.Target;
015import java.lang.reflect.Field;
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
020import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
021
022/**
023 * Utility methods and annotations related to ImageJ's {@link GenericDialog} class.
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/09/14 transfered annotations and dialog-related methods from {@link ParameterBundle}
027 */
028public abstract class DialogUtils {
029        
030        /**
031         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' (value) to be shown for following
032         * parameter fields. Default label is the variable name.
033         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
034         */
035        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
036        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
037        public static @interface DialogLabel {
038                public String value();
039        }
040
041        /**
042         * Annotation to specify the number of digits (value) displayed when showing
043         * numeric values in dialogs.
044         * This annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields.
045         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
046         */
047        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
048        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
049        public static @interface DialogDigits {
050                public int value();
051        }
052
053
054        /**
055         * Annotation to hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
056         * Intended to be used on {@link ParameterBundle} fields.
057         */
058        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
059        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
060        public static @interface DialogHide {
061        }
062
063        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
064
065        private DialogUtils() {}
066        
067        /**
068         * Creates a HTML string by formatting the supplied strings
069         * as individual text lines separated by {@literal <br>}.
070         * The complete text is wrapped by {@literal <html>...</html>}.
071         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addHelp(String)}.
072         * 
073         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
074         * @return a HTML string
075         */
076        public static String makeHtmlString(CharSequence... lines) {
077                return "<html>\n" + String.join("<br>\n", lines) + "\n</html>";
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Creates a string by formatting the supplied strings
082         * as individual text lines separated by newline.
083         * Mainly to be used with {@link GenericDialog#addMessage(String)}.
084         * 
085         * @param lines a sequence of strings interpreted as text lines
086         * @return a newline-separated string
087         */
088        public static String makeLineSeparatedString(CharSequence... lines) {
089                return String.join("\n", lines);
090        }
091        
092        // ------------ Methods related to ParameterBundle  ------------------
093        
094        static Field[] getDialogFields(ParameterBundle params) {
095                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
096                List<Field> dialogFields = new ArrayList<>();
097                for (Field f : clazz.getFields()) {
098                        if (isValidDialogField(f)) {
099                                dialogFields.add(f);
100                        }
101                }
102                return dialogFields.toArray(new Field[0]);
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Adds all qualified fields of the given {@link ParameterBundle} to the specified
107         * {@link GenericDialog} instance, in the exact order of their definition.
108         * Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no 
109         * {@link DialogUtils.DialogHide} annotation is present.
110         * Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code long}, {@code float},
111         * {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
112         * 
113         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
114         * @param gd a generic dialog
115         */
116        public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
117                Field[] dialogFields = getDialogFields(params);         // gets only public fields
118                for (Field f : dialogFields) {
119                        try {
120                                addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
121                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
122                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
123                        }
124                }
125        }
126        
127//      public static void addToDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
128//              Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
129//              Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
130//              for (Field f : fields) {
131//                      if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogHide.class)) {
132//                              continue;
133//                      }
134//                      try {
135//                              addFieldToDialog(params, f, gd);
136//                      } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
137//                              throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
138//                      }
139//              }
140//      }
141        
142        /**
143         * Retrieves the field values of the specified {@link ParameterBundle} from
144         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
145         * The {@link ParameterBundle} is modified. 
146         * Throws an exception if anything goes wrong.
147         * 
148         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
149         * @param gd a generic dialog
150         * @return true if successful
151         */
152        public static boolean getFromDialog(ParameterBundle params, GenericDialog gd) {
153                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = params.getClass();
154                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
155                int errorCount = 0;
156                for (Field f : fields) {
157                        if (!isValidDialogField(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogHide.class)) {
158                                continue;
159                        }
160                        try {
161                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(params, f, gd)) {
162                                        errorCount++;
163                                }
164                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
165                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage()); // TODO: refine exception handling!
166                        }
167                }
168                return (errorCount == 0);
169        }
170        
171        /**
172         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to 
173         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
174         * The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item
175         * unless a {@link DialogLabel} annotation is present.
176         * Allowed field types are {@code boolean}, {@code int}, {@code float},
177         * {@code double}, {@code enum}, and {@code String}.
178         * 
179         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
180         * @param field some field
181         * @param dialog the dialog
182         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
183         */
184        private static void addFieldToDialog(ParameterBundle params, Field field, GenericDialog dialog)
185                        throws IllegalAccessException {
186                
187                String name = field.getName();
188                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogLabel.class)) {
189                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogUtils.DialogLabel.class).value();
190                }
191                
192                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
193                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogUtils.DialogDigits.class)) {
194                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogUtils.DialogDigits.class).value();
195                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
196                }
197                
198                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
199                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
200                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(params));
201                }
202                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
203                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(params), 0);
204                }
205                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
206                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getLong(params), 0);
207                }
208                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
209                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(params), digits);
210                }
211                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
212                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(params), digits);
213                }
214                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
215                        String str = (String) field.get(params);
216                        dialog.addStringField(name, str);
217                }
218                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
219                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(params));
220                }
221                else {
222                        // ignore this field
223                        //throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
224                }
225        }
226
227        /**
228         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item
229         * from the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
230         * 
231         * @param params a {@link ParameterBundle} instance
232         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object 
233         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
234         * @return true if successful
235         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
236         */
237        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
238        private static boolean getFieldFromDialog(ParameterBundle params, Field field, GenericDialog gd)
239                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
240                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
241                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
242                        field.setBoolean(params, gd.getNextBoolean());
243                }
244                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
245                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
246                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
247                                return false;
248                        }
249                        field.setInt(params, (int) val);
250                }
251                else if (clazz.equals(long.class)) {
252                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
253                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
254                                return false;
255                        }
256                        field.setLong(params, (long) val);
257                }
258                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
259                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
260                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
261                                return false;
262                        }
263                        field.setFloat(params, (float) val);
264                }
265                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
266                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
267                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
268                                return false;
269                        }
270                        field.setDouble(params, val);
271                }
272                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
273                        String str = gd.getNextString();
274                        if (str == null) {
275                                return false;
276                        }
277                        field.set(params, str);
278                }
279                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
280                        Enum en = gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
281                        if (en == null) {
282                                return false;
283                        }
284                        field.set(params, en);
285//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
286//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
287                }
288                else {
289                        // ignore this field
290                        // throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
291                }
292                return true;
293        }
294        
295        private static boolean isValidDialogField(Field f) {
296                if (!ParameterBundle.isValidParameterItem(f)) {
297                        return false;
298                }
299//              int mod = f.getModifiers();
300//              if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
301//                      return false;
302//              }
303                // accept only certain field types in dialogs:
304                Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
305                return (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == long.class || 
306                                clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
307                                clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum());
308        }
309
310
